title.narrative: STRENGTHENING JUSTICE SYSTEM

description.narrative: Professionals involved in child protection and justice have strengthened capacities for effective implementation and monitoring of child-friendly and gender-sensitive justice., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the Government implements improved and equitable policy for prevention and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and exclusion of the most vulnerable children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Professionals involved in child protection and justice have strengthened capacities for effective implementation and monitoring ofchild-friendly and gender-sensitive justice.

description.narrative: With UNICEF&39;s support in capacity building;and through advocacy, positive trends in;justice for children;have continued.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022

title.narrative: Assessment standards for children at risk in social welfare and justice sector and availabilty of specialized training(47904), Text

baseline.value: Assessment standards are non-existing and the principle of the best interest of the child is not adhered to.Specialized training not available

target.value: 2022:The standards have been developed and continuous specialized training has been made available to advance practices and adhere to the principle of the best interest of the child.

actual.value: 2021:The standards for the assessment in both social welfare and justice system have been drafted and assessment instrument is being piloted. Needs assessment for training development is being conducted.

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems, Text

baseline.value: Lack of systematic capacity building for justice and psychosocial professionals (juvenile judges, prosecutors and non-legal child professionals).

target.value: 2021:Specialized and systematic training has been made available through programmes, organized by responsible institutions and academies for the professional training of justice and psychosocial professionals in contact with children.
